commit_list.repo_description: A tool for monitoring visual changes in web applications, designed for us in a continuous integration flow.

commit_list.message: Version 0.6.2
commit_list.repo_description: A tool for monitoring visual changes in web applications, designed for us in a continuous integration flow.

commit_list.message:
Reduce memory usage in ThumbnailCreator

When there are a lot of images to thumbnail, it's best not to load them
all into RAM first. In fact, we don't really need to load them at all in
order to thumbnail, just shell out to `convert`. That makes the ruby
garbage collector's job a bit easier.

In my local tests this keeps kontrast's memory usage around 500MB
instead of spiking up to 2.5GB.

Refactor ThumbnailCreator as module functions instead of mixin and add a
spec.

commit_list.message:
worker: Remove Consumer interface, implement TreeWalkingProducer

Fix a couple of broken asusmptions around ProduceConsumer
- Do all producing first, since the tree walking code isn't parallel
anyway. This means we don't need a separate 'done' channel.
- Don't start a new goroutine inside Consume, this just starts 1000s of
goroutines, instead use a fixed worker pool (https://gobyexample.com
/worker-pools)
- We now really don't need the whole Consumer interface, moved that to
worker.consume()

commit_list.message:
Milestone: indexing with DB storage

Integrate the DB storage into the indexing process:
- Refactor some stuff in the index package into its own files
- Handle null timestamps in the DB with NullTime struct
- Add timestamps to schema, and fix a typo
- Handle test database
- Add Store class for storing and finding Photos

- Introduce sqlx
    - Requires exporting (capitalizing) fields in the Photo struct.
    - Use nice features like sqlx.MustConnect which panics if DB isn't there
- Use 'ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING to handle md5sum conflicts. Path conflicts
(which are not expected except for rare race conditions) will now return
a non-application error, which is fine for now.
- Add a Postgres server version check since ON CONFLICT requires v9.5

- Integrate storing Photo record with index
    - Refactor into a FileIndexJob class
    - handle md5 duplicates and set success/fail on the FileIndexJob
    - Print out duplicates

commit_list.message:
Convert CLI parsing to cobra

The cobra CLI parsing framework gives us root config vars (e.g. main-
dir), subcommands (e.g. index, serve, import) and per-subcommand config
vars.

It also has a config file format that might be handy later. It is well
used and well liked!

commit_list.message:
Fix vulnerability in HTTP basic auth

    The existing basic HTTP authentication check was returning `true` in
    scenarios with invalid credentials. This change closes the vulnerability
    and adds specific tests to confirm that valid credentials are required
    to access protected administrative functionality (everything outside of
    the `/ping` endpoint for jobs).

Signed-off-by: Andy O'Neill <andy@potatoriot.com>

commit_list.message:
Better TERM_CHILD default handling for Heroku

- If TERM_CHILD is set, then default to graceful-wait behaviour,
  which seems to be what Heroku expects.
- Allow override via --term-graceful or --term-graceful-wait, which
  also both respect TERM_CHILD and pass TERM to workers when that's set.
- Log the signal we are sending to children, for extra peace of mind.
- Log a warning if it looks like we are running on Heroku and TERM_CHILD
  is not set.
